node.statement:
FOURTH REPAIR -- Step 4 (QED): Assembly.

Combining Steps 1-3:

From Step 1: E_{mu_eps}[exp(alpha <f, :phi_eps^k:>)] = Z_eps^{(alpha)} / Z_eps.

From Step 3: Z_eps^{(alpha)} <= C_1(alpha, f, k), uniformly in eps.

From Step 1: Z_eps >= 1 (by trivial-drift evaluation: -log Z_eps <= E[V_eps(X)] = 0).

Therefore:

  E_{mu_eps}[exp(alpha <f, :phi_eps^k:>)] <= C_1(alpha, f, k) =: M(alpha, f, k)

uniformly in eps > 0.

PITFALL AVOIDANCE:
(1) mu perp mu_0: Not used. Argument at regularized level.
(2) No Wick decomposition: All Wick powers are single objects. The Wick shift :(X+h)^n: = sum (n choose j) :X^j: h^{n-j} involves Wick powers of X times POWERS of h. No C_eps(0) terms.
(3) No Fatou across changing measures: Fixed mu_0 throughout. Passage to mu in node 1.6.2.10.3.
(4) No L^p route: Direct partition function ratio.
(5) No enhanced-data concentration: Not invoked.
(6) No Besov duality needed: Uses spatial L^p norms of deterministic functions.

NO DEPENDENCY on node 1.6.2.10.1.

DEPENDENCIES: BG (2020) Theorem 1.1 and Proposition 4.1; node 1.2 (setup); node 1.5.4 (properties of Z_eps).
